title: Live Ireland — Real-Time National Dashboard
description:
Real-time national dashboard combining Ireland's no-auth public data feeds into 4 tabs: Grid & Energy, Weather & Water, Transport, Outages & Alerts. Highest real-time requirements of all 7 dashboard concepts.

## Tabs

### Tab 1: Grid & Energy
- EirGrid demand/generation/wind/frequency (5-min updates)
- SEMO market prices (30-min)
- ESB outage map
- Gas Networks pressure/demand

### Tab 2: Weather & Water
- Met Eireann observations (25 stations) & active warnings
- OPW water levels (537 stations, 15-min GeoJSON)
- Marine Institute sea state (ERDDAP buoys)
- EPA air quality (AQI by station)

### Tab 3: Transport
- Irish Rail real-time (train positions, 90-sec)
- Luas RTPI (tram arrivals, 30-sec)
- NTA GTFS-R bus/rail positions (30-sec, Protocol Buffers)
- TII traffic counters & journey times (5-min DATEX II)
- Dublin Bikes availability

### Tab 4: Outages & Alerts
- ESB power cut locations & ETAs
- Met Eireann weather warnings (active, GeoJSON)
- OPW flood alerts
- TII road incidents

## Tech Stack
Next.js 16 + React 19 + Tailwind v4 + shadcn/ui + Tremor + ECharts 6 + Perspective 4 + MapLibre GL JS v5 + deck.gl v9.2 + Hono + tRPC v11 + SSE + Supabase + TimescaleDB + Valkey + DuckDB-WASM + Fly.io Dublin + Cloudflare Pages/R2

title: Phase 3: Data Adapter Layer
description:
Build adapters for all Irish public data sources. Each adapter handles polling, parsing, normalization, caching, and error handling.

Adapters to build:
1. EirGrid Smart Grid Dashboard (demand, generation, wind%, frequency, interconnectors) — 5-sec delay between requests to avoid 503, three different date formats across sub-APIs
2. SEMO Market Data (day-ahead & intraday prices) — sort_by=StartTime&order_by=DESC, Date param ignored
3. ESB PowerCheck (outage locations and ETAs)
4. Met Eireann Observations (25 stations, use correct slugs: dublinairport not dublin-airport)
5. Met Eireann Warnings (use prodapi.metweb.ie/warnings/active)
6. OPW Water Levels (HTTPS, ~457 stations, GeoJSON)
7. Marine Institute ERDDAP (URL-encode >= and <= operators)
8. Irish Rail API (train positions, station data, ~90s updates)
9. Luas RTPI XML (tram forecasts, ~30s updates)
10. Dublin Bikes GBFS v2.3 (Cyclocity, no auth)
11. TII Traffic (TMU sites JSON — DATEX II is stale/broken)
12. EPA Air Quality (TBD — awaiting workaround research)
13. Gas Networks (TBD — awaiting workaround research)

Cross-cutting:
- Adapter base class/pattern with: poll interval, retry logic, rate limiting, response validation
- Valkey caching layer for each adapter
- TimescaleDB write for historical storage
- Error logging and alerting for upstream API failures
- Health status per adapter (last successful poll, error count)

Ref: CLAUDE.md (API table and verification notes)
Ref: ideas_and_research/ireland_data/*.md
notes:
EPA AIR QUALITY WORKAROUND FOUND (2026-02-07):
1. EPA airquality.ie (PRIMARY, 15-min, no auth but needs Referer header):
   curl -s 'https://airquality.ie/assets/php/get-monitors.php' -H 'Referer: https://airquality.ie/'
   Returns JSON array of 114 monitors with latest PM10, PM2.5, NO2, O3, SO2, CO readings.
   Response takes 3-5 seconds — must cache server-side.
2. EEA Azure Blob (SECONDARY, hourly, no auth):
   https://dis2datalake.blob.core.windows.net/airquality-derivated/AQI-noRunningMeans/current/{stationCode}.json
   70 Irish stations (EEA codes like IE0028A). Static CDN files, very fast.
3. EPA GeoServer WFS (station metadata/GeoJSON):
   https://gis.epa.ie/geoserver/EPA/ows?service=WFS&version=1.0.0&request=GetFeature&typeName=EPA:AIR_MonitoringSites&outputFormat=application/json
   147 stations with locations. Also has zone boundary layers.

Adapter plan for EPA Air Quality:
- Primary: Poll get-monitors.php every 15 minutes with Referer header
- Cache aggressively server-side (3-5s response time)
- Fallback: EEA Azure Blob for validation and gap-filling
- Station map: EPA GeoServer WFS for GeoJSON markers

title: Phase 9: Historical Data & Client-Side Analytics
description:
Enable historical data exploration with DuckDB-WASM querying Parquet files, and build the Python data pipeline for ETL.

Tasks:
- Set up DuckDB-WASM in browser (Web Worker for non-blocking queries)
- Generate Parquet files from TimescaleDB historical data
- Upload Parquet files to Cloudflare R2
- Implement HTTP Range Request querying of Parquet from DuckDB-WASM
- Build Python ETL pipeline: FastAPI + Polars + DuckDB for scheduled data export
- Create data exploration UI: date range selectors, aggregation controls
- Historical time-series charts with full dataZoom
- Comparative views (e.g., this week vs last week energy demand)
- Export functionality (CSV/JSON download)

Architecture:
- Scheduled job (cron) exports TimescaleDB -> Parquet -> R2
- DuckDB-WASM queries Parquet directly from R2 in browser
- No server round-trips for historical analysis
- Lazy-load DuckDB-WASM (~3MB) only on pages that need it
